title: Fragments [2], 1975-40-1-a,b, mid-18th century
medium:
Silk and metal
Structure/Technique: Continuous and discontinuous supplementary in a plain weave foundation.  [Only the metal wefts are bound to the front in a regular order.]
description: Two parallel curving branches with clusters of flowers on an ivory background.  Minimum repeat unit: warp: 25 cm [9-7/8"] x weft: 26.5 cm [10-1/2"].  The pattern is achieved by horizontally turning every other minimum unit and placing all units one on top of the other.
